question: Which among the following criteria increases the resolving power of an electron microscope?
option1: If wavelength is short and wavelength of electron beam can be made quite small by accelerating the electrons
option2: If wavelength is short and light given by electrons has very short wavelength
option3: If magnification is high and electronic lens provides much higher magnification
option4: If magnification is high and the electron microscope has a battery of lenses to provide high magnification
answer: If wavelength is short and wavelength of electron beam can be made quite small by accelerating the electrons
explanation: As the wavelength of an electron can be up to 100,000 times shorter than that of visible light photons, electron microscopes have a higher resolving power than light microscopes and can reveal the structure of smaller objects.
